item.title: 2 "void type not allowed here" errors
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Snowys way doesn’t even work.

It makes no sense.

It would set the boolean when you attack the player to true, and it will set you to true.

So if someone comes by with the boolean set to false, he can attack the person with the boolean set to true, thus the person not being able to attack back.

Just make a boolean that checks if the player is being attacked.

if(w.e) {
return true;
else
return false;
}

Read full topic

@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

I Lol @ You Mmm.

item.title: 2 "void type not allowed here" errors
item.dc:creator: @Mmm1 Mmm.
item.description:
@Mmm1 wrote:

		client plz = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn];
		if(!inSafezone() && !plz.inSafezone() && plz != null) {
		if (playerRights == 2) {
	    	IsAttacking = true;
	    	inCombat();
	    	setAnimation(GetWepAnim());
		}
		}
		if(inSafezone() || !plz.inSafezone() || plz != null) {
	    	sendMessage("This player is in a safe zone !");
		}
		if(playerRights == 2) {
		sendMessage("This player is already in combat.");
		}

Now, I understand completely what you’re trying to do and that the code I just posted is not what you’re looking for. Try compiling that and see if you get a “void type not allowed” error again. If you don’t then you can limit what the error is - the singlecombat and plz.inCombat - and someone better with Java than me could help more.

Sorry I couldn’t help, but doing this should really limit the problem down so you know what’s wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 "void type not allowed here" errors
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Well I am trying to make single combat zones for wilderness which I am going to release in a tut when it works, and I was wondering what;s wrong. Here’s the piece of the code:

client plz = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn]; if(!inSafezone() && !plz.inSafezone() && plz != null) { if (singleCombat() && !plz.inCombat()) { IsAttacking = true; inCombat(); setAnimation(GetWepAnim()); } } if(inSafezone() || !plz.inSafezone() || plz != null) { sendMessage("This player is in a safe zone !"); } if(singleCombat() && plz.inCombat()) { sendMessage("This player is already in combat."); }

here are the two errors

client.java:18692: 'void' type not allowed here if (singleCombat() && !plz.inCombat()) { ^ client.java:18701: 'void' type not allowed here if(singleCombat() && plz.inCombat()) { ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
